column5: Usually I use Portuguese sardines for ice fishing pike but I found these today at Fortinos...  about 10-12" long..... can't wait to try them out!!!  Anybody ever use the larger mackerels? Burt
What do you use...a quick strike rig?

Years ago I read an article in a fishing magazine about the development of fish scents, as I recall it mentioned that research by Berkley indicated pike were partial to mackerel scent.   http://www.in-fisherman.com/catfish/cut-mackerel-for-catfish/   http://www.users.totalise.co.uk/~robmurray/pikebaitsa.htm
Yes, just a couple of #4 or #6 trebles about 2-3" apart on 30lb SS braided wire.  Burt

Yes, just a couple of #4 or #6 trebles about 2-3" apart on 30lb SS braided wire.  Burt  Is that legal?  Trebles count as three hooks when not attached to an artificial lure.  I have heard of people attached some spinner blades to make it an artificial lure.  I am not sure whether the MNR has an official position on that.  I am assuming that you are in Ontario.
This was changed quite a while back, a treble is considered 1 hook and you are allowed 4. Note that there is no longer a mention counting hook points or live bait.    Burt
